intro: Anemanthele, commonly known as the fairybells, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Anemanthele species typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along streams. They have basal leaves that are usually heart-shaped or kidney-shaped, and their flowers are often clustered in loose racemes. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
